snippet: An easing of some decade-old cultural restrictions, including singing by women in front of men, has given Rawan Okasha an opportunity to start “achieving what is in my soul.”
abstract: Gaza Journal; Rawan Okasha is first woman to sing in public in Gaza in nearly decade under rule of Hamas, which grudgingly permits rare concert as it begins to quietly ease cultural restrictions; under Hamas rules, Okasha must stand still and dress modestly while singing, and audience members are admonished for standing to dance to tunes.

byline.original: By DIAA HADID and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

lead_paragraph: An easing of some decade-old cultural restrictions, including singing by women in front of men, has given Rawan Okasha an opportunity to start “achieving what is in my soul.”

headline.print_headline: With Hamas Watching, Singer Creates a (Modest) Sensation
headline.main: With Hamas Watching, Singer Creates a (Modest) Sensation
